page.title: 09SHOPPING IN KEMPSFORD AREA
page.content: {Kempsford, Dunfield, Castle Eaton }and {Marston Meysey}are served by a bakery at{Kempsford}and Post Office/Stores at {Kempsford}and{Castle Eaton}. There are no facilities at{Marston Meysey}or {Dunfield.}Milk is delivered daily. A baker's van calls, and weekly a mobile wet fish van and a fish and chip van. The main grocery shopping is done weekly at supermarkets, generally in {Cirencester.}Home refigerators and deep freezers make this possible and has caused the demise of village shops. Furniture, clothing etc. tend to be purchased in{Swindon.}Available public transport is limited, so private transport is necessary creating problems for non-drivers, the elderly or sick - but neighbours help. A community minibus operates around the local villages two mornings a week taking shoppers to {Fairford.
